intro: Triticum urartu var. binarturutriru, commonly known as a wild wheat species, is a grass native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is characterized by its slender stalks and small, spikelet-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its genetic makeup is of interest to researchers due to its potential contributions to modern wheat breeding programs. However, this particular variety is relatively obscure and not widely cultivated.
